title: Slope of a Line
text: The slope of a line can be determined using two points $$(x_1,y_1)$$, $$(x_2,y_2)$$ by subtracting the y-values over the x-values: $$\frac{y_2-y_1}{x_2-x_1}$$.
speech: The slope of a line can be determined using two points  parentheses, x sub 1 comma y sub 1,  , , parentheses, x sub 2 comma y sub 2,   by subtracting the y-values over the x-values:  fraction, y sub 2 minus y sub 1, over, x sub 2 minus x sub 1,  .
pacedSpeech: The slope of a line can be determined using two points   , x sub 1 comma y sub 1,
by subtracting the y-values over the x-values:   fraction, y sub 2 minus y sub 1, over, x sub 2 minus x sub 1,

title: Slope of a Line
text: Substituting the points $$(-3,2)$$, $$(5,-2)$$, the slope is equal to $$\frac{\left(-2-2\right)}{5-\left(-3\right)}$$

title: Slope of a Line
text: $$\frac{-4}{8}$$ can be simplified to get the slope of the line.
